actions-list.actionItem: Pursuant to the order of yesterday, the Journal of the proceedings of the Senate was deemed approved to date.
Pursuant to the order of yesterday, the morning hour being deemed expired, and the times for the recognition of the two leaders being reserved.
The following transactions of morning business occurred on today.

PN162:
        Patrice H. Kunesh, of Minnesota, to be Commissioner of the Administration for Native Americans, Department of Health and Human Services

        -- Cloture invoked in Senate by Yea-Nay Vote. 62 - 34. Record Vote Number: 46 


        -- Considered by Senate.

        -- By unanimous consent agreement, debate and vote 3/8/2023.


 PN166:
        Robert Stewart Ballou, of Virginia, to be United States District Judge for the Western District of Virginia

        -- Considered by Senate.

        -- Confirmed by the Senate by Yea-Nay Vote. 59 - 37. Record Vote Number: 41 



 PN178:
        Andrew G. Schopler, of California, to be United States District Judge for the Southern District of California

        -- Cloture invoked in Senate by Yea-Nay Vote. 57 - 39. Record Vote Number: 42 


        -- Considered by Senate.

        -- Confirmed by the Senate by Yea-Nay Vote. 56 - 39. Record Vote Number: 43 



 PN179:
        Arun Subramanian, of New York, to be United States District Judge for the Southern District of New York

        -- Cloture invoked in Senate by Yea-Nay Vote. 58 - 37. Record Vote Number: 44 


        -- Considered by Senate.

        -- Confirmed by the Senate by Yea-Nay Vote. 59 - 37. Record Vote Number: 45 



 PN185:
        Ismail J. Ramsey, of California, to be United States Attorney for the Northern District of California for the term of four years

        -- Considered by Senate.

        -- Confirmed by the Senate by Voice Vote.


 PN186:
        Kate E. Brubacher, of Kansas, to be United States Attorney for the District of Kansas for the term of four years

        -- Considered by Senate.

        -- Confirmed by the Senate by Voice Vote.
Under the authority of the order of today, at  6:35 p.m, the Presiding Officer (Mr. Warnock in the chair) declared the Senate adjourned, under its order of today, until 10 a.m. tomorrow.
